solution: The angles $2x^{\circ}$ and $3x^{\circ}$ shown are complementary and thus add to $90^{\circ}.$ Therefore, $2x+3x=90$ or $5x=90$ and so $x=\frac{90}{5}=\boxed{18}.$
model_solution:
The angle measures of the two triangles are related by $3x^\circ=2x^\circ+90^\circ$.
Subtract $2x$ from both sides of the equation to get $x^\circ=90^\circ$.
Divide both sides of the equation by $3$ to get $x^\circ=30^\circ$.
Divide both sides of the equation by 3 to get $x^\circ=30^\circ$.

full_steps: The angle measures of the two triangles are related by $3x^\circ=2x^\circ+90^\circ$.
Subtract $2x$ from both sides of the equation to get $x^\circ=90^\circ$.
Divide both sides of the equation by $3$ to get $x^\circ=30^\circ$.
Divide both sides of the equation by 3 to get $x^\circ=30^\circ$.
